name: Glow Multi-Use Illuminating Gel-Powder Highlighter
ingredients: Dimethicone, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, C30-45 Alkyl Dimethicone, Synthetic Wax, Dimethicone/Vinyl Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Zinc Stearate, Dimethiconol, [May Contain/Peut Contenir/+/-: Iron Oxides (Ci 77491, Ci 77492, Ci 77499), Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891)].
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-An ideal multi-use tool, it can be used on the eyes, cheeks, nose, and lips, as well as on the body. ..Face:.-Using a brush or fingers, sweep the product on the high points of the face (upper cheekbones, brow bones, bridge of the nose and Cupidu2019s bow) to highlight. .-Build and blend to intensify the glow as desired. ..Eyes: .-Using a brush, apply the product to the inner corner of the eyes and the center of the eyelids to illuminate. .-Gucci Glow highlighter powder can also be used as an eyeshadow on its own. .-Using a brush or a finger, apply the product all over the eyelids. Build and blend to intensify the color as desired. ..Body:.-To add some extra glow, sweep some product on the collarbone and decolletage. .-Complete the look with Poudre de Beaute Eclat Soleil (sold separately) for a sunkissed glow and Blush de Beaute (sold separately) for a touch of color on the cheeks and/or eyes.

reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve purchased / used MANY highlighters this year, and the Gucci Glow Highlighter in Opal Pink is by far my favorite. The powder gel formula, created with a high pearl concentration, has a luminous glow subtle enough to look natural - you wonu2019t find micro-glitter here - yet, the wearer appears lit from within. The smooth, buildable formula doesnu2019t enhance or create texture; it applies evenly and quite naturally.  The packaging is true to the Gucci branding and luxury status. Though itu2019s priced higher than other highlighters, in this case, the cost is truly reflective of the quality. A little goes a long way.

reviews.review_title: Good light or heavy opacity highlighter
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product for free in exchange for review, and I think it might be my favorite highlighter that hasnu2019t been discontinued, but Iu2019m somewhat surprised to say that because Iu2019d passed over purchasing it after seeing reviews (which were good, but not consistent with what I look for so I think this has a lot of versatility).   Personally when I use highlight I want everything to look like my skin rather than stand out as makeup. To achieve this result, given that I have light-medium skin with a very pink undertone, I look for a light/medium depth with a pink/peach color, no noticeable shimmer and low opacity. Originally looking at this product the color and lack of shimmer looked on point, but I thought it might be a bit too deep (looked medium+) and I questioned the opacity for personal use since many reviewers who want a u201chighlighter you can see from spaceu201d were singing its praise. Upon use I found that color-wise shade 04 was great for what Iu2019m looking for, similar Doll Dynasty from Hindash (which is a bit lighter on both sides of the shift) or Pat McGrathu2019s Divine Rose in pink packaging (though the Gucci leans a bit more reddish bronze than pink on the non-gold end of the shift). The depth was in fact a medium, maybe medium+ by my estimate, but I didnu2019t see an off shift with light use on my skin. When it comes to opacity, where I feel this really shines, you have the ability to apply the product very naturally with a light hand or build it up for a high opacity look. There are also no noticeable sparkle particles in the formula, though you can make it very metallic with a high-opacity application. Lastly thereu2019s no noticeable scent I could pick up from application and the compact feels very solid.  I think the Chanelu2019s discontinued Reve de Camelia is still my personal favorite, but only because itu2019s so light on the skin (with none of Gucciu2019s versatility to build up shine/opacity). That said, of currently available formulas, Iu2019d pick and recommend Gucci.

reviews.review_title: Radiance Redefined u2013 A True Masterpiece!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The Gucci Glow Highlighter is pure luxury in a compact. From the moment I applied it, I was absolutely mesmerized by how effortlessly it enhanced my natural radiance. This highlighter is truly a game-changer, with its unique powder-gel formula that feels weightless and blends seamlessly into the skin.  The texture is airy and ultra-thin, giving a soft, translucent glow that feels tailored to my complexion. It doesn't sit on the skin but becomes one with it, creating a luminous, lit-from-within look. Whether Iu2019m going for a subtle daytime shine or an evening glam, this highlighter delivers every single time.  What sets it apart is how it celebrates individualityu2014this isnu2019t about masking; itu2019s about revealing. My skin looks vibrant, healthy, and undeniably glowing. The packaging is as elegant as the product itself, making it a statement piece for any vanity.  Gucci has outdone themselves with this highlighteru2014itu2019s not just makeup; itu2019s an experience. If youu2019re ready to elevate your beauty routine, this is an absolute must-have!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: First of all the packaging is amazing!!! It feels very luxurious but itu2019s also lightweight which is perfect for traveling.   I received shade u201cOpal Pink 04u201d and itu2019s a very pretty color that could work for light-medium skin tones.   Overall the formula is great, it feels very buttery and works well with other products (cream + powder products) that I use. It has a natural yet flattering finish - this is not an overpowering, blinding highlighter and it does not accentuate your imperfections. This is almost a better version of what the Becca highlighters were back in the day.   I usually apply this after applying my cream blush, and spraying my face with some Mac Fix+.  I love this for the days when Iu2019m not going for a full beat but still want my skin to have a healthy glow - Iu2019m obsessed to say the least, and already bought 2 more shades!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The Gucci Glow Highlighter in Opal Pink is absolutely stunning. Itu2019s a bronzed peach champagne shade that leans towards a light peachy pink, but the bronzy gold tones really stand out once applied. The compact itself feels luxurious with its sturdy weight, magnetic closure, and built-in mirror. I love the yellow gold packaging and the starburst design on the frontu2014itu2019s so chic!  The pressed powder is super easy to apply, is creamy and blendable, and the pigmentation is amazing ud83eudd29. Just one swipe gives you an opaque glow, so itu2019s not one of those highlighters where you have to keep building it up (which I really appreciate!). The texture feels fantastic on the skin, and it has such a versatile formulau2014it works beautifully as a highlighter, an eyeshadow, or even a blush-lighter for a subtle cheek glow. Plus, the quality of the packaging really elevates the whole experience. Definitely worth it for the glow and the luxury feel!

reviews.review_text: This highlighter is everything I was looking for! I am 35 and Iu2019ve been through so many highlighters by now and still feel like most of them are just too obvious. I think the name is slightly misleading because the highlighter is definitely more pink than gold (although you can get pink sunrises). I like the color because my skin is fair toned but definitely something to keep in mind if you are looking for actual gold tone highlighter.

Luckily the highlighter is still intact and didnu2019t fall onto the floor and break all over the place, but this is honestly unacceptable for a nearly $60 highlighter. Comparing just the packaging of this highlighter next to my Dior highlighter, I would have assumed this one to be less than half the price of Dior, but it actually costs more. I collect tons of Dior, Chanel, Tom Ford and a little Hermes beauty so I was really excited to try my first Gucci beauty product but I am definitely disappointed. This highlighter is a splurge, but itu2019s worth every penny if youu2019re after a luxurious, long-lasting glow. reviews.review_title: Replaced my Pat McGrath as my favorite highlighter
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Wow, this is a gorgeous highlighter! As someone who's dangerously close to checking the 55 & up category box, I'm looking for smooth, glowy and incandescent in a highlighter, and I don't want glitter, sparkle or anything that is going to accentuate the texture that comes with skin that has matured untouched by the needle or scalpel. Gucci has created a magical highlighter that does just that for me. I chose the Opal Pink shade as it looked most flattering for my fair skin and it is neutral enough to go with almost any other makeup I'm wearing (i.e. it's not that pink, more a smokey rosy pink that looks like an extension of a natural blush if that makes sense). I absolutely love this stuff! It smooths out my skin, gives my cheekbones a lift and adds a credible but glamorous light to my skin. Prior to buying the Gucci, my favorite highlighter was Pat McGrath in the platinum shade. It also has all the incredible attributes of lifting, smoothing and accentuating BUT it broke during shipping every time I purchased it, which was very disheartening and just a hassle to deal with. Plus this shade from Gucci is something Mother Pat would never (or at least hasn't thus far, and her most creative era seems sadly behind her if the PML releases of late are any indicator). The compact is gorgeous too, a dreamy pink and gold handful of luxury. So, would I repurchase? Oh my yes. I don't think I'm going to need to as I see this one compact lasting me a very long time, but yes, I'd buy again even at full price (bought during the savings event). Worth every penny to me!

reviews.review_title: The Gucci Glow Highlighter is a true gem in my mak

Whether Iu2019m going for a full glam evening look or just want a subtle highlight for my daily makeup, it works beautifully every time. I like this texture because itu2019s not crumbled not from brush or from fingers due the applying but lies on the skin very evenly. My experience. This highlighter doesnu2019t work equally well for all my face parts, because I have sensitive and combined skin and on the dry parts (under the eyebrow or on my eyelid) it lies and looks perfect. But for my cheekbone it doesnu2019t work well, unfortunately. Because oily skin on this part of my face absorbs radiance very quickly no matter how much amount of highlighter I applied. But this product didnu2019t cause any acne or rashes. Conclusion This is a very good highlighter for dry skin, has a gentle but visible glow and high-quality texture.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Love love love love the packaging!!!!! Just cannot say that enough. Have you ever had a component so difficult to open that you accidentally dig your nail into trying to pry the packaging open? I have, and not just with one component either. That is wear the luxury beauty aspect comes in, Gucci thought this through. The lip to open this product is the best I've ever tried by far, and Ive tried ALL the top cosmetics lines, and have never fallen in love such a specific thing on a product, but seriously the lip to open this makes it so easy. I have family with limited ability to use there hands (arthritis, and hand trembles among others)  and when I showed them this I was so happy that they each went and bought a color of their own choosing due to how much they absolutely love the component, it's worth it trust me!!!  As for the actual product inside, it was very subpar. It was marketed as a gel powder hybrid but it just fell flat on so many different levels. It did not give up any kind of beautiful shine, just bland metallic blotchy patchy mediocrity. Just absolutely disappointed me as I love a lot from the Gucci brand and have yet to come up across a product that I didn't absolutely love. So not even liking or enjoying this product inside was quite a shock to me as they are one of my favorite brands. Not worth the price, I think this needs to be reformulated. Please swatch before buying.

First, I love the design of this compact powder. The gold metallic outer casing looks very luxurious, feels lightweight, and is quite sturdy. The powder inside has a soft, smooth textureu2014it's neither powdery nor gel-like, which is very interesting. When I lightly touched the surface with my finger, I picked up quite a bit of product. At this point, my face had been wearing makeup all day, and when I got home and received the gift from Influenster, I opened it immediately to try it outu2014I just couldnu2019t wait. Since it was 11 p.m., the lighting in my room wasn't ideal, so whatever you see in the video, you should multiply it by three to get an accurate idea. It reflects light beautifully and adheres well without needing much powder. In summary, this product is totally worth it. I love it so much and will repurchase when I run out. For those of you with fair Asian skin, I think warm gold is the perfect shade.

I absolutely love the versatility of this shade, Frosted Lilac has a cool, silvery finish that looks beautiful on my upper cheekbones but I also love using it to highlight the clavicle and cleavage areas, it really reflects the light! This formula provides me with a long lasting cool shimmer that blends perfectly with my light skin tone and feels good on my dry skin. The packaging is simple, a lightweight plastic compact, gold in color with the Gucci name, it does include a mirror which is nice for on the go. reviews.review_title: A must have product for sure.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: **Gucci Makeup Glow Highlighter in Warm Bronze u2013 Review**  If you're in the market for a highlighter that combines opulence with a touch of everyday elegance, Gucciu2019s Glow Highlighter in Warm Bronze might just be your new go-to. This luxurious product lives up to the brand's reputation for sophistication and quality.  **Packaging:** The highlighter comes in a sleek, gold compact that exudes high-end charm. The design is classic Gucci, with the iconic interlocking Gs embossed on the surface. Itu2019s not just a beauty product; itu2019s a statement piece for your makeup collection.  **Formula:** The formula is where this highlighter truly shines. It boasts a finely milled texture that blends seamlessly into the skin. The Warm Bronze shade is perfect for adding a radiant, sun-kissed glow without veering into overly glittery territory. The finish is more of a luminous sheen rather than a stark shimmer, making it versatile for both day and night looks.  **Application:** Applying the Glow Highlighter is a breeze. Whether you use a brush, sponge, or your fingers, it blends effortlessly and provides a buildable effect. You can achieve a subtle glow with a light touch or build it up for a more intense highlight. The pigmentation is just rightu2014not too overpowering, but enough to give your cheekbones, brow bones, and other high points a beautiful, warm glow.  **Longevity:** This highlighter holds up well throughout the day. It stays in place and maintains its radiant finish without fading or settling into fine lines. Itu2019s ideal for long days at the office or special events where you want to keep your glow intact.  **Shade Versatility:** The Warm Bronze shade is particularly flattering for medium to deep skin tones, adding a natural warmth and dimension. For lighter skin tones, it can be used as a beautiful, sunkissed highlighter or even a subtle bronzer.  **Overall Impression:** it is a luxurious treat for anyone looking to elevate their makeup routine. A must have product.

reviews.review_text: Gucci Glow Highlighter is a luxuriously silky illuminating powder featuring a powder-gel formula. This is not an in your face highlighter with lots of flashy glitter. Itu2019s gives you more of that u201cglass skinu201d look and like youu2019re glowing from within with subtle (yet intentional) iridescence. I can see this being a great everyday highlighter to give you that fresh, hydrated, and youthful looking skin. I found that I did have to apply this more liberally to get the look I desired on my pale skin, but definitely noticed a subtle glow on my skin throughout the day. As expected, the packaging is beautiful and I love that it includes a mirror. Iu2019m excited to try other colors in the future!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Alright, listen up, makeup lovers! I just got my hands on the Gucci Glow Highlighter in Frosted Lilac, and let me tell you, my life has officially peaked. This little compact of magic is like having a disco ball for your face u2014 and I mean that in the best possible way.  First off, let's talk about the packaging. It's Gucci, so obviously, itu2019s fancy. But this compact is giving me all the vintage-glam vibes, like something your fabulously eccentric aunt would pull out at a holiday dinner while dropping pearls of wisdom and casually mentioning her time in Paris.   Now, onto the highlighter itself. When I first saw the shade Frosted Lilac, I thought, Is this going to make me look like a pastel alien? Spoiler alert: It does, but like, in a *good* way. The color is this dreamy, iridescent lilac that somehow manages to look both subtle and extra all at once. How does it do that? I have no idea. Gucci might actually have a wizard on their payroll.  Application-wise, it glides on smoother than a TikTok influencer's transition. One swipe, and BAM u2014 you're glowing like you just got back from a vacation on the sun (but without the sunburn or awkward tan lines). And the best part? It doesnu2019t leave that weird, chunky glitter effect. You know, the one that makes it look like you let a toddler do your makeup? Yeah, this is more of a I woke up like this because I am an ethereal goddess situation.  Wear time? All day, baby. I wore this to a party last night, and by the end, I was still shining brighter than everyone elseu2019s future. It didnu2019t budge, and thatu2019s saying a lot because I danced like my life depended on it.   So, should you buy the Gucci Glow Highlighter in Frosted Lilac? Uh, yes! If you want to light up every room you walk into and get stopped on the street by people asking, OMG, what highlighter are you wearing? this is your new best friend. Just be prepared to say, Oh, this? Itu2019s Gucci. And watch their jaws drop.

reviews.review_text: This Gucci highlighter is a game-changer for achieving that perfect skin-like glow. It blends seamlessly into the skin, leaving behind a radiant finish that looks completely naturalu2014no glitter or shimmer in sight. Instead of sitting on top of your skin, it melts in, giving the appearance of naturally flawless, expensive-looking skin. Itu2019s as if youu2019re glowing from within, with just the right touch of luxury. Also, there really isnu2019t any pigment to this product so it should work on a wide range of skin tones.

reviews.review_text: You know, I am not a huge highlighter person. This stuff is translucent, feels amazing on, and provides a subtle glow that even my 52 year old skin can pull off! Absolutely in love.

reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this Gucci highlighter! The packaging is so luxurious and the texture of the powder is so soft. Itu2019s very pigmented and easily bendable for minimum to maximum highlight (depending on the look)!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this item complimentary from Influenster in exchange for my honest review. This Gucci illuminating powder is a must have product for your makeup routine. It is so beautiful and blends extremely well! I believe the shade I received u201csunrise goldu201d can be used on a wide variety of skin tones. Iu2019m on the more pale side and gold colored highlighter usually looks very obvious but with this Gucci highlighter it looks as natural as a highlighter could possibly look which I love because natural looking makeup for me is best! I added a swatch to show the natural, subtle glow this illuminating powder gives!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Very nice packaging and this highlighter is beautiful. Packaging is gorgeous and the shade I received is sunrise gold 01. Although it looks white in color it shows up fluorescent on the skin in person, giving a pink/purplish hue which is perfect for a light summer makeup look. There are three shades and I couldu2019ve chosen a deeper tone but nevertheless itu2019s noticeable in person and thatu2019s the highlight of this product! The texture is smooth and buildable on the skin. I used a blush brush to apply the product to the cheekbones. It was amazing! I give this gel to powder highlighter two thumbs up!
